@J-N-K How to handle this?

(search == null && activity.id ==null) || (search != null && search.equals(activity.id))
would this work? if one of search and activity.id is guaranteed to be non-null, you can omit the first check.

Currently the ttsVolume is set parallel to all devices in a group, after it the tts is requested and after this the standardVolume is set. Its possible to see this workflow in the log file. So i think it is not necessary to ignore the volume change, there is no major reason to do.
Sound perfect
